A 2015 Nissan GT-R, that's a beast of a car! Modifying it for drifting is a great way to unlock its full potential. You've already done some solid upgrades, and now it's time to focus on the wheels.

For a GT-R, you'll want wheels that can handle the power and torque of that twin-turbo V6. Enkei wheels, as I mentioned earlier, are a great choice. Their RPF1 and RS05 models are popular among GT-R owners, and for good reason. They're lightweight, strong, and designed to handle high-performance driving.

Since you're drifting, you'll want wheels that can handle the stresses of aggressive cornering and high-G forces. Look for wheels with a high-strength rating, and consider a wheel with a forged or flow-formed construction. These types of wheels are designed to be stronger and more durable than cast wheels.

When choosing a wheel size, consider a wider wheel with a lower offset to improve handling and stability during drifting. A 19x10 or 19x11 wheel with a -10 to -15 offset would be a good starting point for a GT-R. This will give you a wider footprint and more aggressive stance, which will help with traction and stability during drifting.

Some other wheel brands you might want to consider for your GT-R include:

* Volk Racing: Their TE37 and ZE40 wheels are popular among GT-R owners, and are known for their high-strength and aggressive design.
* Nismo: As the performance arm of Nissan, Nismo wheels are designed specifically for the GT-R and are a great choice for drifting.
* Rays Engineering: Rays is a Japanese wheel manufacturer that's known for their high-performance wheels, including the popular Volk Racing and Gram Lights brands.

Remember to do your research and read reviews from other GT-R owners who have experience with drifting. It's also a good idea to consult with a wheel expert or a reputable tuner to ensure you're getting the right wheels for your car and driving style.

How's your drifting experience so far? Have you had a chance to take your GT-R out on a track or a drift event?
